transcripts.transcript_text:
Speaker B: Has been forwarded to voicemail. The person you are trying to reach is not available. At the tone, please record your message. When you have finished recording, you may hang up.
Speaker A: Hi Abhishek, this is Shikha from Amber Student and this call is regarding your recommendation. You are searching in UK so let me know your convenient time to connect with you. Or else you can reach out to me on WhatsApp. Thank you.
Speaker A: Call has been forwarded to voicemail. The person you are trying to reach is not available. At the tone, please record your message. When you have finished, record.

Speaker B: Hello?
Speaker A: Hello? Hello?
Speaker B: Yes, Yes. Who's calling? Can you call me back in a minute? I can't hear you. Let me just get in a good network zoom.
Speaker A: Wait a second. I'm audible now. Can hear me?
Speaker B: Not really. There's a lot of disturbance.

Speaker A: Hello?
Speaker B: Hello? Yes, can you hear me now? I'm audible.
Speaker A: I can. Yeah, you are.
Speaker B: Yeah. Yeah, right, yeah.
Speaker A: Sorry I've not been able to answer some of your last few calls.
Speaker B: No worries, no worries.
Speaker A: I can give you a overview of what my situation is right now and then maybe you can give me the correct guidance. So I'm not actually associated with UCL directly. My wife is going to going to join UCL as a postdoctorate research fellow. So.
Speaker B: All right.
Speaker A: We are looking to move sometime around next month to the uk and in that case is it possible that since I'll be moving in as a dependent of my wife. So we are looking for something that can accommodate both of us like a dual occupancy. So I think my wife was also in touch with one of your other colleagues from Amber itself.
Speaker B: Okay, may I know her good name?
Speaker A: I think it's Arushi or I think that's the name.
Speaker B: No, no, no, your wife good name. So she's in touch with Arushi.
Speaker A: Yeah, my wife's name is Namrita Halgar.
Speaker B: Namrita, that's right. Yeah. I can see that she's already in touch with my colleague. Arushi.
Speaker A: Correct. So I think let's just keep one channel of communication. If she's already in touch with Arushi, I don't think there's any point.
Speaker B: Yeah, yeah, I'll just inform Arushi like. Yeah, I'll just inform Arushi to going forward to get in touch with you both and she will gonna create a WhatsApp group and she gonna you out both about the accommodation.
Speaker A: She knows the history. So my wife has spoken to her a few times.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker A: She's quite up to date on what the.
Speaker B: Okay, great. I'll just keep her updated about you. So why your wife is your like student and you are the dependent. Right?
Speaker A: She's not a student. I mean I don't think postdoc. Postdocs are considered as students in that sense.
Speaker B: Okay.
Speaker A: So I think there might, might be some, some sort of limitation or restrictions in terms of what type of accommodation can be given to us. But I think.
Speaker B: But you are independent, you are not.
Speaker A: I am the dependent. Yeah, correct.
Speaker B: Okay, got it. All right. I'll just keep in touch with Arushi and her like I'll just get an overview and we'll update you about the same. And meanwhile like I'll also ask her to get in both like touch with you and like share the option accordingly.
Speaker A: It sure sounds good.
Speaker B: Yeah. Thank you so much for the update.
Speaker A: Thank you. Bye.
Speaker B: Bye. Bye.
